p:
Phytochemical investigation of the 80% methanol extract of C. abyscinicum bulbs by PTLC afforded two compounds, with R
f values of 0.62 (compound 1) and 0.44 (compound 2) (mobile phase: n-BuOH/H 2O/AcOH/4 : 5 : 1). Compounds 1 and 2 produced orange colour when sprayed with Dragendorff's reagent (a solution of potassium bismuth iodide prepared from basic bismuth nitrate (Bi(NO 3) 3)), tartaric acid, and potassium iodide (KI), suggesting that they are alkaloids [ 21].
